meanings.definition: A rock formation or mineral deposit that is enclosed within a body of rock of different origin.
meanings.sent1: The geologist found an inlier of quartz within the granite.
meanings.sent2: The inlier of marble stood out in the midst of the surrounding limestone.
meanings.sent3: The inlier of gold in the rock seemed like a hidden treasure waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent4: The inlier of silver shone like a tiny star in the dark rock.
meanings.sent5: The inlier of diamond sparkled brightly against the dull background of the stone.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is situated or exists within a specified region or context.
meanings.sent1: The new student was an inlier in the class, quickly making friends.
meanings.sent2: The rare flower was an inlier among the common plants in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The cat considered itself an inlier in the dog park, confidently strolling around.
meanings.sent4: The unique painting was an inlier in the art gallery, drawing attention from visitors.
meanings.sent5: The old book was an inlier on the modern bookshelf, adding a touch of history to the collection.
